creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Augustus L. Searle
description: glass, with coating of red lacquer; green jade top; medallions cut from the lacquer; hand-painted scene on glass
text: The vases, plum tree branches, books, rocks, and fruit shown on this snuff bottle are together known as “pure offerings of spring” (suizhao qinggong), a common motif in Chinese painting. These depictions of specific groups of symbolic and functional objects were typically created for the celebration of the New Year; they conveyed good fortune and acted as a reminder for optimism throughout the coming year.
title: Snuff Bottle
